III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 (1) A child caring institution shall establish and
Section follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
Description forms of intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment
including, but not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing,
kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When youth previously resided at facility, their arm was pulled out
of their socket by a staff member. The youth put their own arm
back in the socket. No medical attention was sought.
Investigation Investigation
Contact with Complainant was unable to be made as he or she is
unknown.
On 11/21/2024 an email correspondence was received from FCW.
She provided background information to myself and DHHS
specialist regarding Youth A. It was noted that Youth A identifies
as transgender and has a preferred name. She also advised that
Youth A made progress in their overall mental stability while
placed at Vista Maria. Youth A transitioned to DA Blodgett’s step-
down program in April 2024. It was also noted that Youth A has a
history of making false claims.
On 11/22/2024 an in-person interview was held with Youth A by
DHHS Specialist 2 at DA Blodgett in Grand Rapids, MI. I was
able to participate via telephone. Youth A was asked about her
previous placement at Vista Maria approximately two years ago.
She recalled being placed at Vista Maria and stated that she did
not like it there. She stated Staff 1 pulled her arm out of socket
while she was placed at Vista Maria. She reported that she was
going after Youth B in an attempt to fight her and was restrained
by Staff 1. She stated she was resisting and continued trying to go
after Youth B. She recalled she was pushed into a wall and she
then dropped to the floor. She stated Staff 1 fell on top of her.
She described the restraint as her arms being placed behind her
back and then the staff pushed upward. She stated Staff 1 pulled
both of her arms towards her back in an attempt to restrain her
and this is when her arm came out of the socket. She reported
Staff 1 was advising her if she calmed down that he would let her
go. She reported it happened in Freedom Hall over a year ago.
She reported another female staff witnessed the incident, but did
2

not intervene. She did not recall the female staffs name. She did
not recall any other staff or youth present during the incident. She
denied that she was seen by a nurse after the incident. She
confirmed that the area had cameras but stated the video footage
was deleted because of HIPPA laws. She could not recall how
long she remained in the reported restraint and stated after it was
over she went to her bedroom. Youth A then reported concerns
with camera flashes and lighting outside of her bedroom window
while placed at Vista Maria. This allegation was investigated and
documented in SI Investigative Report 2024SIC0001585. There
were no findings of non-compliance. Youth A also shared
concerns regarding the bedroom doors being locked at night while
she was placed at Vista Maria. This allegation is currently being
investigated and findings are pending. The SI report #’s are
2025SIC0000212 and 2025SIC0000213. Lastly Youth A reported
that Youth C was sexually abused by a staff member at Vista.
She denied knowing any other details, but stated she was told this
by Youth C. This concern was called into Centralized Intake (Log
ID#:152791045).
On 11/25/2024 an email correspondence occurred with assigned
FCW. She reported having no concerns for Youth A while placed
at Vista Maria. She denied that Youth A ever expressed concerns
to her regarding her arm being pulled out of socket by a staff at
Vista Maria.
On 11/26/2024 an onsite visit was made to Vista Maria by myself
and DHHS Specialist. An interview was held with Compliance.
He was advised of the allegations and informed that it occurred
over a year ago. He was informed that it involved Youth A and
Staff 1. He confirmed that Staff 1 is no longer employed with the
agency and possibly resides in Kentucky. Compliance confirmed
placement dates of Youth A as 3/7/22 to 4/5/24 with placements at
Freedom, Deroy and Biata Halls. There are no current youth at
Vista who were placed with the agency during that time from 2022
to 2024. Compliance also advised that there is only one staff that
remains employed and identified her as Staff 2. She is currently a
contingent staff. Compliance denied knowledge of any incidents
involving Youth A and Staff 1 that resulted in an injury to her arm.
On 11/26/2024 an email correspondence was received from
Compliance that included incident report that involved Youth A
and Staff 1. He advised that due to the time frame, what he pulled
is not in the current format and does not include much information.
He also provided contact numbers for Staff 1 and Staff 2.
3

On 12/09/2024 telephone calls were made to contact numbers
provided for Staff 1 and Staff 2. Voicemail messages were left to
return call regarding Vista Maria special investigation.
On 12/13/2024 a telephone call was made to Staff 1. A voicemail
message was left requesting a return call.
On 12/13/2024 a telephone call was held with Staff 2. She
confirmed that she is a contingent staff at Vista Maria. She stated
that she already advised the other worker (DHHS Specialist) that
she has not seen Youth A in over two years. She denied
knowledge of a time when Staff 1 would have restrained Youth A
or a time when Youth A complained of arm pain as a result of a
restraint. She further denied seeing Staff 1 be inappropriate with
youth at the facility.
On 12/19/2024 interviews were held with Staff 3 and Staff 4 at
Visita Maria. They both denied knowledge of Youth A or Staff 1.
They denied having knowledge of inappropriate discipline
techniques or inappropriate restraint techniques being utilized at
the facility.
On 12/19/2024 interviews were held with Youth D and Youth E at
Vista Maria. They both denied knowledge of Youth A or Staff 1.
They denied having knowledge of inappropriate discipline
techniques or inappropriate restraint techniques being utilized at
the facility.
On 12/19/2024 a DHHS Pre-Dispositional meeting was held via
Teams. DHHS Specialist, Area Manager and FCW were present.
No findings were made by DHHS and preliminary findings of
compliance were provided by DCWL.
Documents Reviewed
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy: Policy indicates that the
following behaviors are prohibited, and employees who engage in
prohibited acts are subject to discipline, up to and including
termination (see Disciplinary Procedure, 022-110):
• Fighting, assaulting, threatening or intimidating co-workers,
security, clients, customers, or guests.
Wolverine Incident Report: The incident report is not dated. The
IR states that Youth A was physically and verbally aggressive,
hitting and biting staff, and placed on observation.
4

HR disciplinary information for Staff 1: It indicated a
termination date of 3/27/2024 and has the following disciplinary
actions:
1/26/24 - Final warning violation of In Service Training policy
(Failure to meet 25 hours of training in 2023)
8/25/23 - Written warning due to medication error (demotion from
TL to Youth Counselor)
8/11/23 - Medication remediation med error
4/25/23 - Medication remediation med error
3/30/23 - Medication remediation med error
12/30/22 - Memo to file regarding conversation with supervisor (It
was reported that Staff 1 smelled of alcohol)
2/9/21 - Verbal Warning Violation of policy (failure to notify
parent/guardian of client's physical altercation)
DHHS Social Work Contact: Documented face to face interview
of Staff 1 by DHHS specialist on 12/17/2024 at a local tire shop in
Detroit, MI. In regard to the allegations, Staff 1 advised that if he
recalls the correct incident, it was almost two years ago. He stated
Youth A was fighting Youth C, and that staff were attempting to
separate the girls. He stated that he was blocking Youth A from
being able to get to Youth C while other staff attempted to get
Youth C off of the unit. Staff 1 advised that he did not remember
who the other staff were or if any other youth were around. He
stated that the incident occurred at Freedom Hall. He denied that
he had ever restrained Youth A and that he just blocked her with
his arms in the air. He denied that he has ever twisted Youth A’s
arm or that she ever required medical attention. He denied that he
ever fell on Youth A at any point but stated that she did fall or trip.
He stated that this occurred about 9 months before he left Vista
Maria and Youth A had never complained about her arm or
anything at all during this time and there.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews were completed
with both staff and youth and there was no evidence to support
non-compliance with the licensing rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
